>>4. Do you use the JUnit addons? How likely is it that we will need 
>>them?
> 
> You don't need them, but it's good to know what Vladimir offers, in case you'd rather use someone else's code over building your own.

If you've been beaten by "expected <......> but was <... ...>" I bet you 
will :-)

Writing tests is like writing code: everyone has his own recipe.  There 
are things I feel are missing from JUnit that's why I ended up with 
JUnit-addons.  But anyone is free to not use it :-)

-Vladimir
